issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi All,

Following is seen in /var/log/eucalyptus/httpd-nc_error_log on a 3.1 system at the node controller, the instance running stops responding and had to be rebooted 

{code}
[Mon Jul 30 16:06:57 2012] [notice] caught SIGTERM, shutting down
[Mon Jul 30 16:11:55 2012] [notice] Apache/2.2.15 (Unix) Axis2C/1.6.0 configured -- resuming normal operations
[Mon Jul 30 16:12:50 2012] [error] server reached MaxClients setting, consider raising the MaxClients setting
[Tue Jul 31 15:55:41 2012] [notice] caught SIGTERM, shutting down
[Tue Jul 31 16:01:53 2012] [notice] Apache/2.2.15 (Unix) Axis2C/1.6.0 configured -- resuming normal operations
[Tue Jul 31 16:03:23 2012] [notice] caught SIGTERM, shutting down
[Tue Jul 31 16:07:54 2012] [notice] Apache/2.2.15 (Unix) Axis2C/1.6.0 configured -- resuming normal operations
[Tue Jul 31 16:08:13 2012] [error] server reached MaxClients setting, consider raising the MaxClients setting
[Wed Aug 01 10:10:15 2012] [notice] caught SIGTERM, shutting down
[Wed Aug 01 10:10:16 2012] [notice] Apache/2.2.15 (Unix) Axis2C/1.6.0 configured -- resuming normal operations
[Wed Aug 01 10:13:50 2012] [error] server reached MaxClients setting, consider raising the MaxClients setting
[Wed Aug 01 11:06:11 2012] [notice] caught SIGTERM, shutting down
[Wed Aug 01 11:15:59 2012] [notice] Apache/2.2.15 (Unix) Axis2C/1.6.0 configured -- resuming normal operations
[Wed Aug 01 11:16:24 2012] [error] server reached MaxClients setting, consider raising the MaxClients 

setting *** glibc detected *** /usr/sbin/httpd: double free or corruption (!prev): 0x00007f1c91cb36c0 ***
Hide quoted text
======= Backtrace: =========
/lib64/libc.so.6(+0x3979075366)[0x7f1c8e1cc366]
/lib64/libc.so.6(+0x3979077e93)[0x7f1c8e1cee93]
/usr/lib64/axis2c/lib/libapr-1.so.0(apr_allocator_destroy+0x1d)[0x7f1c8e71df7d]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3f48e)[0x7f1c8fc5948e]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3fb7b)[0x7f1c8fc59b7b]
/lib64/libpthread.so.0(+0x397940f500)[0x7f1c8e4f8500]
/lib64/libc.so.6(accept4+0x5f)[0x7f1c8e2409af]
/usr/lib64/axis2c/lib/libapr-1.so.0(apr_socket_accept+0x4a)[0x7f1c8e721e8a]
/usr/sbin/httpd(unixd_accept+0x21)[0x7f1c8fc5aa71]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3f7a3)[0x7f1c8fc597a3]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3fb1a)[0x7f1c8fc59b1a]
/usr/sbin/httpd(ap_mpm_run+0xc1c)[0x7f1c8fc5a79c]
/usr/sbin/httpd(main+0xb60)[0x7f1c8fc31900]
/lib64/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xfd)[0x7f1c8e175cdd]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x16899)[0x7f1c8fc30899]
Hide quoted text
======= Memory map: ========
7f1c70000000-7f1c7068a000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f1c7068a000-7f1c74000000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f1c78000000-7f1c78371000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f1c78371000-7f1c7c000000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f1c7c9b0000-7f1c7c9b1000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f1c7c9b1000-7f1c7d3b1000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f1c7d3b1000-7f1c7d3b2000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f1c7d3b2000-7f1c842a0000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f1c842a0000-7f1c842b6000 r-xp 00000000 fd:00 15466760 /lib64/libgcc_s-4.4.6-20120305.so.1
7f1c842b6000-7f1c844b5000 ---p 00016000 fd:00 15466760 /lib64/libgcc_s-4.4.6-20120305.so.1
7f1c844b5000-7f1c844b6000 rw-p 00015000 fd:00 15466760 /lib64/libgcc_s-4.4.6-20120305.so.1
7f1c844b6000-7f1c84502000 r-xp 00000000 fd:00 2757634 /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusGL/libEucalyptusGL.so
7f1c84502000-7f1c84702000 ---p 0004c000 fd:00 2757634 /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusGL/libEucalyptusGL.so
7f1c84702000-7f1c84705000 rw-p 0004c000 fd:00 2757634 /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusGL/libEucalyptusGL.so
7f1c84705000-7f1c84706000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f1c84706000-7f1c84717000 r-xp 00000000 fd:00 2362430 /usr/lib64/libfa.so.1.3.4
7f1c84717000-7f1c84916000 ---p 00011000 fd:00 2362430 /usr/lib64/libfa.so.1.3.4
7f1c84916000-7f1c84917000 rw-p 00010000 fd:00 2362430 /usr/lib64/libfa.so.1.3.4
7f1c84917000-7f1c8492a000 r-xp 00000000 fd:00 2367216 /usr/lib64/libexslt.so.0.8.15
7f1c8492a000-7f1c84b2a000 ---p 00013000 fd:00 2367216 /usr/lib64/libexslt.so.0.8.15
7f1c84b2a000-7f1c84b2b000 rw-p 00013000 fd:00 2367216 /usr/lib64/libexslt.so.0.8.15
7f1c84b2b000-7f1c84b6c000 r-xp 00000000 fd:00 2367215 /usr/lib64/libaugeas.so.0.14.0
7f1c84b6c000-7f1c84d6c000 ---p 00041000 fd:00 2367215 /usr/lib64/libaugeas.so.0.14.0
7f1c84d6c000-7f1c84d6e000 rw-p 00041000 fd:00 2367215 /usr/lib64/libaugeas.so.0.14.0
{code}

We might want to check https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/gatherlog/handlers.c for any possible bugs which could cause this?

Note that the Linux distribution is CentOS 6.3 and version of httpd is httpd-2.2.15-15.el6_2.1.x86_64

Let me know if further information is required.
fields.summary: possible double free or corruption in eucalyptus-gl code

comments.body:
Hi Deependra,

Could you shed some light as to how we can reproduce this?

Additionally, looking at the following error:

{code}
setting *** glibc detected *** /usr/sbin/httpd: double free or corruption (!prev): 0x00007f1c91cb36c0 ***
{code}

The memory map id {code}0x00007f1c91cb36c0{code} couldn't be found in the error message in the initial ticket. This could be associated another issue.  

Let us know if you have any additional questions.

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Hi Harold,

I have had no luck reproducing it. But this is caused when the instance running on the NC looses SSH or networking in general. This happens every 5 to 10 minutes.

If you see the back trace you would see a Eucalyptus library file hence I have mentioned in the ticket about a *possible* double free or corruption coming through Eucalyptus (GL). It might have been that the Eucalyptus-GL code is trying to free a pointer which was already free'd 

I am going to attach 2 more logs to this ticket which looks almost similar (double free corruption) and this time instead of Eucalyptus (GL) points to Eucalyptus (NC) library file.

I have also been told that we could run the NC and GL into valgrind and use electric fence for debugging the issue, but currently I lack expertise to do that. 

In my opinion we could try to debug the code to ensure we do not have this problem and if its related to httpd (apache) instead.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Cheers!
Deependra

Removing network mode and OS as it has been seen with MANAGED, MANAGED-NOVLAN and STATIC networking mode.

Hypervisor is still KVM and Linux distribution are (where this is seen):

RHEL 6.2
RHEL 6.1
CentOS 6.3

Ok, did some research on this in case this is known issues and looked at both backtrace and saw some commonalities. Both time the double free occured when calling apr_allocator_destroy() in the axis2c library. Not too sure what's being double freed at this time, I need to look at this code. But essentially here's the 2 backtrace from the information Deependra provided:

Dump1:
{code}
/lib64/libc.so.6(+0x3979075366)[0x7f1c8e1cc366]
/lib64/libc.so.6(+0x3979077e93)[0x7f1c8e1cee93]
===> /usr/lib64/axis2c/lib/libapr-1.so.0(apr_allocator_destroy+0x1d)[0x7f1c8e71df7d]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3f48e)[0x7f1c8fc5948e]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3fb7b)[0x7f1c8fc59b7b]
/lib64/libpthread.so.0(+0x397940f500)[0x7f1c8e4f8500]
/lib64/libc.so.6(accept4+0x5f)[0x7f1c8e2409af]
/usr/lib64/axis2c/lib/libapr-1.so.0(apr_socket_accept+0x4a)[0x7f1c8e721e8a]
/usr/sbin/httpd(unixd_accept+0x21)[0x7f1c8fc5aa71]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3f7a3)[0x7f1c8fc597a3]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3fb1a)[0x7f1c8fc59b1a]
/usr/sbin/httpd(ap_mpm_run+0xc1c)[0x7f1c8fc5a79c]
/usr/sbin/httpd(main+0xb60)[0x7f1c8fc31900]
/lib64/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xfd)[0x7f1c8e175cdd]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x16899)[0x7f1c8fc30899]
{code}

Dump 2:
{code}
/lib64/libc.so.6(+0x38b6875296)[0x7f8ac7ed5296]
/lib64/libc.so.6(+0x38b6875296)[0x7f8ac7ed5296]
===> /usr/lib64/axis2c/lib/libapr-1.so.0(apr_allocator_destroy+0x1d)[0x7f8ac8423f0d]
===> /usr/lib64/axis2c/lib/libapr-1.so.0(apr_allocator_destroy+0x1d)[0x7f8ac8423f0d]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3f48e)[0x7f8ac995f48e]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3fb7b)[0x7f8ac995fb7b]
/lib64/libpthread.so.0(+0x38b6c0f4a0)[0x7f8ac81ff4a0]
/lib64/libc.so.6(nanosleep+0x2d)[0x7f8ac7f0b15d]
/lib64/libc.so.6(sleep+0xe0)[0x7f8ac7f0afd0]
/usr/sbin/httpd(+0x3f48e)[0x7f8ac995f48e]
/usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so(monitoring_thread+0x6df)[0x7f8ac1b6558b]
/lib64/libpthread.so.0(+0x38b6c077f1)[0x7f8ac81f77f1]
/lib64/libc.so.6(clone+0x6d)[0x7f8ac7f45ccd]
{code}
Deependra, do we have an idea how much traffic/load these machines were under?

Hey Charles,

At one site the instance was under heavy load as it was running Oracle DB but thats the only instance there.

I am going to attach /var/log/messages from that NC , hope that helps.

In eng-support sync: we would like to ask if we can run the following commands (and send us the output), on the running NC in question:

# httpd -V
# httpd -t -D DUMP_MODULES 
# httpd -f /etc/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf -t -D DUMP_MODULES
# rpm -qa
# ps axww | grep httpd

Please also include NC logs during the timeframe where the double free is observed, if possible.

Found similar issue reported about mod_qos

http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/forums/forum/697421/topic/3508707/index/page/1

Hi Dan,

I have asked for information and logs requested, shall update this ticket once the same are received. 

Thanks again.
Deependra, would you happen to know what date/time the double free occurred. This will help to narrow down messaging in the logs.
Please move this bug back to confirmed once the data has been gathered.

Sure, I have asked for nc.log and exact date/time when the double free occurred. 

Its strange that there is no time mentioned in the httpd-nc_error_log for the double free but for other log messages?
All information is provided, no more information available.

Thanks Deependra,

At this time there's not much we can do to work on this. Discussing with Dan, to move forward, we would need 1 of the following:

- A reproduction of the double-free on an NC running under GDB or;
- The NC logs reported at the time of failure.
- A series of steps to reproduce this in house.
Feedback provided

Charles,

Please see the logs uploaded on 19th September for this ticket, let me know if you have trouble accessing the logs and I shall send you an email.

Cheers!
Deependra
moving to investigating and reviewing with Engineering.
[~dstagnaro] any update since september on this ticket? i think there were couple of fixes which made their way into 3.2.0 , wanted to check if they cleared up this one?
Chuck, the log for the NC has been added.  Can you take a look at this and comment?
Oups! Since I was no longer the assignee, I never got the updates on this one. Looking at the logs and will update.

Unfortunately the logs aren't providing much information in regards to where we fail. I thought this could have helped to get the logs and thanks for it but unfortunately I think that the only thing that would help here is a list of steps to reproduce in house or a stack trace with the debug symbols in there. 

I'll try one more thing and see if I can compile the stack and decipher the address...

Looking more into this case, this is an issue with apache. This does not trigger the NC code. Searching for double free with apr_pool_destroy in google will lead to many threads looking at an issue with apache. Unless we can duplicate with the apache symbols, I have no idea what code path within apache leads to this double free.
